document_data.name: Ghostharp
document_data.mainbody: '''''Ghostharp''''' was an uncommon [[spell]] used by [[bard]]s and [[wizard]]s.
document_data.Effects: This spell was cast onto an object. When cast, the spell would search the area within {{SI|50|ft}} of the object for the most recent song that was played or sung within the previous day. When the spell detected a song, its melody recorded onto the object. When the caster spoke the spell's verbal command, "Play", the object replayed the music. The music continued playing until the caster spoke "Stop" or the spell expired. The spell was not able to record conversations, and it's recording of a song was not perfect. It was unable to replicate magical effects or cast spells.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[somatic component|somatic]] components, the caster's flesh needed to be touching a small harp for the spell to work.
document_data.History: This spell was commonly used by the [[Seven Sisters]] and some [[Harpers]].
